config.title: Your config settings
config.text:
Below are all the config settings of your server.
Use `{{ prefix }}config <key>` to view a single setting
Use `{{ prefix }}config <key> <value>` to set the config <key> to <value>
config.canNotClear: The config setting **{{ key }}** can not be cleared. You can use `config {{ key }} default` to reset it to the default value.

current.title: Current Value
current.text:
This config is currently set.
Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} <value>` to change it.
Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} default` to reset it to the default.
current.notSet:
This config is currently **not** set.
Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} <value>` to set it.
current.clear: Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} none` to clear it.

config.sameValue: This config is already set to that value.

changed.text:
This config has been changed.
Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} <value>` to change it again.
Use `{{ prefix }}config {{ key }} default` to reset it to the default.

invalid.mustBeTextChannel: That channel is not a text channel.
invalid.canNotReadMessages: I don't have permission to **read messages** in that channel.
invalid.canNotSendMessages: I don't have permission to **send messages** in that channel.
invalid.canNotSendEmbeds: I don't have permission to **embed links** in that channel.

args.key: The config setting which you want to show/change.
args.value: The new value of the setting.

self.description: Show and change the config of the server.
self.title: cmd.config.self.title

memberConfig.title: Member Config
memberConfig.text:
Below are all the available member config settings.

Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig <key>` to view the users which have a `<key>` setting
Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig <key> @user` to view the setting for a single `@user`
Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig <key> @user <value>` to set the config `<key>` to `<value>` for `@user`
memberConfig.canNotClear: The member config setting **{{ key }}** can not be cleared. You can use `memberConfig {{ key }} default` to reset it to the default value.
memberConfig.notSet: This member config settings is currently not set for any members

current.title: Current Value
current.text:
This member config is currently set.

Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} <value>` to change it.
Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} default` to reset it to the default.
Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} none\` to clear it.}}
current.notSet:
This member config is currently **not** set.

Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} <value>` to set it.

memberConfig.sameValue: This member config is already set to that value

changed.text:
This member config has been changed.

Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} <value>` to change it again.
Use `{{ prefix }}memberConfig {{ key }} {{ username }} none` to reset it to the default.

args.key: The member config setting which you want to show/change.
args.user: The member that the setting is shown/changed for.
args.value: The new value of the setting.

setup.title: Setting up InviteManager
setup.text: After inviting the bot, all invites will be tracked automatically.

joinLeave.title: Setting join and leave message channel
joinLeave.text: If you want to display join and or leave messages in one of your channels, you have to configure that channel by doing `!config joinMessageChannel #channel` or `!config leaveMessageChannel #channel`. Make sure the bot has write permissions in those channels!

prefix.title: Changing the prefix
prefix.text:
You can change the prefix by doing `!config prefix !`

If you don't know the bots prefix, you can find it using `@InviteManager config prefix`.

faq.title: FAQs and more
faq.text: A complete guide on setting up the bot can be found here: https://docs.invitemanager.co/bot/

help.title: Help
help.text: If you need help or have feedback, you can either use the `!feedback` command or join our discord support server: {{{ link }}}

premium.title: Premium
premium.text:
If you would like to support the development of this bot, you can do so by supporting us on Patreon: {{{ link }}}

Depending on the tier, you will get some additional features.

manageGuild.title: Missing permission: Manage Server
manageGuild.text: The bot does not have the "Manage Server" permission. This permission is required to read the invites of the user. Without this permission the join messages won't work.

manageRoles.title: Missing permission: Manage Roles
manageRoles.text: The bot does not have the "Manage Roles" permissions. This permission is required to assign roles to a user. Without this permission members cannot be auto-promoted.

viewAuditLogs.title: Missing permission: View Audit Logs
viewAuditLogs.text: The bot does not have the `View Audit Logs` permissions. This permission allows the bot to better track invites.

self.description: Help with setting up the bot and checking for problems (e.g. missing permissions)
self.title: cmd.setup.self.title

noPremium.title: You currently do not have a premium subscription
noPremium.text: By subscribing to a premium tier you help the development of the bot and also get some additional features.

servers.title: Premium Feature: Up to 5 servers
servers.text: Once you have premium you may activate it on up to 5 servers of your choosing, and you can change these 5 servers anytime.

embeds.title: Premium Feature: Embeds in join messages
embeds.text:
You can use an embed in your join and leave messages which look a lot better.
[See some examples here]({{{ link }}})

export.title: Premium Feature: History export
export.text: You can export all the joins and leaves that happened on your server since you invited our bot.

patreon.title: If you purchsed premium on Patreon
patreon.text: Run {{{ cmd }}} to validate and activate your Patreon plegde.

premium.title: InviteManager Premium
premium.text:
Your premium subscription is valid for another {{ date }}.

You have activated premium on {{{ limit }}} servers.
{{{ guildList }}}

[What can I do with premium?]({{{ link }}})

premium.activate: Use {{{ cmd }}} to activate it on this server

Use {{{ cmd }}} for more info.

interactiveConfig.welcome:
Use the reactions to pick one of the available options.
Use {{{ prev }}} and {{{ next }}} if there is more than one page.
Use {{{ up }}} to go up a menu.
Use {{{ cancel }}} to exit the menu.

values.channel[]: A list of channels, for example: #general #bot-commands
values.role[]: A list of roles, for example: @Admin @Mod
values.string[]: A list of words, for example: word another "word with space"

add.title: Add
add.text: Add a new value to the list.

remove.title: Remove
remove.text: Remove an existing value from the list.

set.title: Set
set.text: Set the whole list using space separated values.

clear.title: Clear
clear.text: Clear the whole list of all values.

interactiveConfig.remove: Enter a value or a list of values to remove.
interactiveConfig.add: Enter a value or list of values to add.
interactiveConfig.set: Enter the new values for the list.

mentions.description: Automatically remove messages with too many mentions.

emojis.title: Emojis
emojis.description: Automatically remove message with too many emojis.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: The prefix used to trigger bot commands.

logChannel.title: Log Channel
logChannel.description: The channel where bot actions are logged.

getUpdates.title: Get Updates
getUpdates.description: Enable to receive development updates about InviteManager.

joinMessage.title: Message
joinMessage.description: The message sent when someone joins the server.

joinMessageChannel.title: Message Channel
joinMessageChannel.description: The channel that the message on join is sent to.

rankAssignmentStyle.title: Assignment Style
rankAssignmentStyle.description: How ranks are rewarded to users.

rankAnnouncementChannel.title: Announcement Channel
rankAnnouncementChannel.description: The channel where users receiving a new rank are announced.

rankAnnouncementMessage.title: Announcement Message
rankAnnouncementMessage.description: The message that is sent when a user receives a new rank.

leaveMessage.title: Message
leaveMessage.description: The message sent when someone leaves the server.

leaveMessageChannel.title: Message Channel
leaveMessageChannel.description: The channel that the leave message is sent to.

autoSubtractLeaves.title: Auto Subtract
autoSubtractLeaves.description: Automatically remove invites from the inviter when the invited user leaves.

autoSubtractLeaveThreshold.title: Auto Subtract Threshold
autoSubtractLeaveThreshold.description: The time in seconds for which a user has to stay in the server for the invite to count.

leaderboardStyle.title: Style
leaderboardStyle.description: The display style of the leaderboard.

hideLeftMembersFromLeaderboard.title: Hide left members
hideLeftMembersFromLeaderboard.description: Hide members that left the server from the leaderboard.

channels.title: Command channels
channels.description: The channels in which the bot will react to commands.

ignoredChannels.title: Ignored channels
ignoredChannels.description: The channels in which the bot will ignore commands.
